page.title: 03Local Government
page.content: About 500 people work in the council offices, some work inside and some work outside. On top of the town centre are the rates offices. The council deal with improving and planning,repairs on houses, rates and rent collection. Parks and playgrounds are improved. There are also 5 football pitches, 5 cricket pitches,10 bowling greens and 30 tennis courts to look after. 73,000 meals per year are produced and taken around by Meals-on-Wheels. 55,000 tons of rubbish per year are collected by the dustmen. The Mayor is the chair person of the council of Port Talbot. He opens functions and greets people and attends 300-400 functions per year. The council is also responsible for business licences and allotments.
